```{r Basic normalisation}
dataframe <- iris
#create copy of object
dataframe1 <- dataframe
#automatic name changes
dataframe1 <- dataframe %>%
  janitor::clean_names()
#change column names of specific ones by number
colnames(dataframe1)[c(1,3,5)] <- c("Sepal.Lengths", "Petal.Lengths", "Species Name")
#set row names

#ensure no duplicate lines
dataframe1 <- dataframe1 %>%
  distinct()
#add row
new_row <- c(5,2,2,0.1,"cervus")
dataframe2 <- rbind(dataframe1, new_row)
#add column
new_col <- dataframe2[c(2)]
colnames(new_col)[c(1)] <- c("Sepal.Depths")
dataframe3 <- cbind(dataframe2, new_col)

#To Add - setting row names, melts, joins both long and short, set column type, binds, string pad
```

```{r subsetting types}
dataframe <- iris
# keep only some columns by number
dataframe1 <- dataframe[,c(1,2,3,4)]
# keep only some rows by number
dataframe2 <- dataframe[c(1,2,3,4),]
# keep only some columns by name
dataframe3 <- dataframe[,c("Sepal.Width", "Species")]
# sort by column values - ascending is default
dataframe <- dataframe %>%
  arrange(desc(Sepal.Length))
```
